reply.question: 1. Does the app declare the collection of data?

answer.full_answer: Yes, the app declares the collection of data.

reply.analysis: The privacy policy clearly states that personal information is collected, and it provides details on the kinds of personal information collected.
reply.reference: The ways we collect personal information: We collect your personal information directly from you unless it is unreasonable or impracticable to do so. URL: https://ehoa.app/policies/privacy-policy

reply.question: 2. If the app declares the collection of data, what type of data does it collect?

answer.full_answer: The app collects data such as country, iwi, energy data, emotional data, menstrual cycle data, full name, date of birth, transactional information, and user behavior.

reply.analysis: The privacy policy document outlines the various types of data collected by the app, including personal information like full name and date of birth, as well as other data related to energy, emotions, and menstrual cycles.
reply.reference: The app collects data such as country, iwi and data that you have input in relation to your energy, emotions and menstrual cycle. All other information about you including identifying information will not be disclosed as part of our research findings. We may collect your full name, We may also collect personal information generated by your use of the Services, such as transactional information, data that you have input and behaviour while using the app. If you are using Ehoa, we may also collect your date of birth. URL: https://ehoa.app/policies/privacy-policy

reply.question: 3. Does the app declare the purpose of data collection and use?

answer.full_answer: Yes, the app declares the purpose of data collection and use as outlined in the privacy policy.

reply.analysis: The privacy policy explicitly states that the app declares the purpose of data collection and use.
reply.reference: The app declares the purposes of data collection and use in various instances throughout the privacy policy. URL: https://ehoa.app/policies/privacy-policy

reply.question: 4. Can the user opt out of data collection or delete data?

answer.full_answer: Yes, the user can opt out of data collection or delete data.

reply.analysis: The privacy policy states that users have the right to access, correct, or request the deletion of personal information held by the app.
reply.reference: You have the right to access and request correction of any personal information that we hold about you, subject to certain exceptions. If you believe any information we hold about you is incorrect, incomplete or inaccurate, then you may request that it be amended. URL: https://ehoa.app/policies/privacy-policy

reply.question: 5. Does the app share data with third parties?

answer.full_answer: Yes, the app shares data with third parties as stated in the privacy policy.

reply.analysis: The privacy policy states that the app may disclose user information to employees, contractors, service providers, suppliers, third parties with commercial relationships, and any other person for authorized purposes with the user's consent. It also mentions the possibility of transferring personal information to a third party purchaser in case of a business sale.
reply.reference: The app may disclose your information to our employees, related bodies corporate, contractors or service providers for the purposes of operating our Application, Website, our research, business or the Services...URL: https://ehoa.app/policies/privacy-policy

reply.question: 6. If the app shares data with third parties, what third parties does the app share data with?

answer.full_answer: The app shares data with its employees, related bodies corporate, contractors, service providers, suppliers, sponsorship partners, law enforcement agencies, regulatory authorities, governmental authorities, and any other person with explicit consent.

reply.analysis: The privacy policy outlines various entities with which the app may share data, including a broad range from employees and service providers to governmental authorities and persons with explicit consent.
reply.reference: The app shares data with its employees, related bodies corporate, contractors, service providers, suppliers, sponsorship partners, law enforcement agencies, regulatory authorities, governmental authorities, and any other person with explicit consent. URL: https://ehoa.app/policies/privacy-policy
